title: Books to Read: The Best Reviews of May
sub_head: ‘The Bomber Mafia,’ ‘Finding the Mother Tree,’ ‘Facing the Mountain’ and more of the books our reviewers highlighted this month.
body:
A selection of the month’s most noteworthy books, as discussed by The Wall Street Journal’s reviewers.
By Philip Hoare | Pegasus
The author of “The Sea Inside” takes a fascinating and typically eclectic dive into the visionary world of the Renaissance artist Albrecht Dürer. Christoph Irmscher writes: “I doubt that any other writer has grasped so deeply the feral, sensual undercurrent of Dürer’s art.”
Read the review
